column4: Hello. Upgrading ubuntu completely messed up my system. I have a separate home partiton though with all my data, but it's encrypted :( how can I get the data off from a live cd?
oh dear
yes. and I can't boot into the old ubuntu as my grub is completely broken, and something went wrong with the upgrade too. It's rather depressing :(. Is there a way I can get my data back?
yeah it seems quite a lot of people haev had issues upgrading 9.04 to 9.10, well 9.10 should be clean installed really anyway,  because of  default Ext4 for clean installs and Grub 2
maybe the 9.04 Live CD or something  and then  gain access to your partition?
I had ext4 on jaunty and it worked fine though... It would really suck if I lost all my data though, as I don't really have any backups.
or the 9.10 Live CD even yes the desktop one
yeah Ext4 in 9.04 is nice,  it's just not perfectly stable
since the kernel they have and that
I can acesss the partition from the livecd fine, but my home directory is encrypted with eCryptfs
you need to access it the normal Ubuntu way I think,  but then again I haven't  done encrypted partitions
what do you mean normal ubuntu way? bbiab.
However you access  them normalley using Ubuntu
well, normally the encrypted partitions are mounted automatically by ubuntu when I log in.
Maybe they will be on a clean install of 9.10

I think you haven't quite understood my problem: When installing 9.04 from the alternate cd, there was an option like "encrypt my home directory", which I enabled. Now I need to get to this encrypted data to make a backup after which I can then upgrade ubuntu.
I know about the option on the CD,  I  have never used it though,  so  my attempted help might not be good enough.   I guess the key has to be some where, and if you removed it,  your buggered
no, I didn't remove it.
what list are you on about then?
What I'm asking is how I can mount an ecryptfs encrypted home directory.
A clean install or upgrade?
